description: Indicates the neighbor discovery trap.
This SNMP trap is generated when the neighbor is discovered.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-NAC-MIB::hwNacNeighborFindTrap HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortIndex i 0 HUAWEI-NAC-MIB::hwDslamNacSlaveMac s EXAMPL HUAWEI-NAC-MIB::hwDslamNacSlaveType s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-NAC-MIB::hwDslamNacSlaveIfFrameId i 9999 HUAWEI-NAC-MIB::hwDslamNacSlaveIfSlotId i 9999 HUAWEI-NAC-MIB::hwDslamNacSlaveIfPortId i 9999

description: Frame Index,the number of the frame in the device.
This table is also adopted by the case-shaped device with Agent
(For example, the MA5105).
There is no frame in this kind of device. Thus it is placed on
the rack with other devices During implementation. The frame index
is specified as 0.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex

description: Slot index that identifies the physical position of a slot.
The case-shaped device is treated as the one with only one slot whose index is always set as 0.
If there are ports in the frame, all the ports on the frame must be virtualized as
a fixed slot index (equal to the virtual slots which is the max slot index for the frame plus
1.) Their slot index is also fixedly set as 0.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex

description: Port index, the index of this table, which exclusively
determines all the ports in a subboard.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortIndex

description: Indicates the MAC address of the NAC slave node.
This node is read-only.
variables.name: HUAWEI-NAC-MIB::hwDslamNacSlaveMac

description: Indicates the device type of the NAC slave node, in the form of a character string.
This node is read-only.
variables.name: HUAWEI-NAC-MIB::hwDslamNacSlaveType

description: Indicates the subrack ID of the slave port on the slave node.
This node is read-only.
variables.name: HUAWEI-NAC-MIB::hwDslamNacSlaveIfFrameId

description: Indicates the slot ID of the slave port on the slave node.
This node is read-only.
variables.name: HUAWEI-NAC-MIB::hwDslamNacSlaveIfSlotId

description: Indicates the port ID of the slave port on the slave node.
This node is read-only.
variables.name: HUAWEI-NAC-MIB::hwDslamNacSlaveIfPortId

description: Indicates the neighbor disappearance trap.
This SNMP trap is generated when the neighbor disappears.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-NAC-MIB::hwNacNeighborDisappearTrap HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortIndex i 0 HUAWEI-NAC-MIB::hwDslamNacSlaveMac s EXAMPL HUAWEI-NAC-MIB::hwDslamNacSlaveIfFrameId i 9999 HUAWEI-NAC-MIB::hwDslamNacSlaveIfSlotId i 9999 HUAWEI-NAC-MIB::hwDslamNacSlaveIfPortId i 9999

This table is also adopted by the case-shaped device with Agent
(For example, the MA5105).
There is no frame in this kind of device. Thus it is placed on
the rack with other devices During implementation. The frame index
is specified as 0.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex

The case-shaped device is treated as the one with only one slot whose index is always set as 0.
If there are ports in the frame, all the ports on the frame must be virtualized as
a fixed slot index (equal to the virtual slots which is the max slot index for the frame plus
1.) Their slot index is also fixedly set as 0.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex

description: Port index, the index of this table, which exclusively
determines all the ports in a subboard.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortIndex

description: Indicates the MAC address of the NAC slave node.
This node is read-only.
variables.name: HUAWEI-NAC-MIB::hwDslamNacSlaveMac

description: Indicates the subrack ID of the slave port on the slave node.
This node is read-only.
variables.name: HUAWEI-NAC-MIB::hwDslamNacSlaveIfFrameId

description: Indicates the slot ID of the slave port on the slave node.
This node is read-only.
variables.name: HUAWEI-NAC-MIB::hwDslamNacSlaveIfSlotId

description: Indicates the port ID of the slave port on the slave node.
This node is read-only.
variables.name: HUAWEI-NAC-MIB::hwDslamNacSlaveIfPortId

description: Indicates the configuration success trap.
This SNMP trap is generated when the NAC parameters are successfully configured.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-NAC-MIB::hwNacConfigOkTrap HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortIndex i 0 HUAWEI-NAC-MIB::hwDslamNacSlaveMac s EXAMPL HUAWEI-NAC-MIB::hwDslamNacSlaveIfFrameId i 9999 HUAWEI-NAC-MIB::hwDslamNacSlaveIfSlotId i 9999 HUAWEI-NAC-MIB::hwDslamNacSlaveIfPortId i 9999 HUAWEI-NAC-MIB::hwDslamNacSlaveVlan i 1 HUAWEI-NAC-MIB::hwDslamNacSlaveIpAddress a 192.0.2.1 HUAWEI-NAC-MIB::hwDslamNacSlaveIpMask a 192.0.2.1

description: Frame Index,the number of the frame in the device.
This table is also adopted by the case-shaped device with Agent
(For example, the MA5105).
There is no frame in this kind of device. Thus it is placed on
the rack with other devices During implementation. The frame index
is specified as 0.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex

description: Slot index that identifies the physical position of a slot.
The case-shaped device is treated as the one with only one slot whose index is always set as 0.
If there are ports in the frame, all the ports on the frame must be virtualized as
a fixed slot index (equal to the virtual slots which is the max slot index for the frame plus
1.) Their slot index is also fixedly set as 0.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex

description: Port index, the index of this table, which exclusively
determines all the ports in a subboard.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortIndex

description: Indicates the MAC address of the NAC slave node.
This node is read-only.
variables.name: HUAWEI-NAC-MIB::hwDslamNacSlaveMac

description: Indicates the subrack ID of the slave port on the slave node.
This node is read-only.
variables.name: HUAWEI-NAC-MIB::hwDslamNacSlaveIfFrameId

description: Indicates the slot ID of the slave port on the slave node.
This node is read-only.
variables.name: HUAWEI-NAC-MIB::hwDslamNacSlaveIfSlotId

description: Indicates the port ID of the slave port on the slave node.
This node is read-only.
variables.name: HUAWEI-NAC-MIB::hwDslamNacSlaveIfPortId

description: Indicates the VLAN ID of the NAC channel, ranging from 1 to 4093.
In response to the get or get_next operation, the invalid value 4096
returned indicates that the VLAN ID is not configured.
This node is mandatory for the configuration of NAC parameters.
variables.name: HUAWEI-NAC-MIB::hwDslamNacSlaveVlan

description: Indicates the IPv4 address of the NAC channel.
In response to the get operation, the invalid value 255.255.255.255
indicates that the IPv4 address is not configured.
This node is mandatory for the configuration of NAC parameters.
variables.name: HUAWEI-NAC-MIB::hwDslamNacSlaveIpAddress

description: Indicates the subnet mask of the IPv4 address for the NAC channel.
In response to the get operation, the invalid value 0.0.0.0 indicates that the subnet mask is not configured.
This node is mandatory for the configuration of NAC parameters.
variables.name: HUAWEI-NAC-MIB::hwDslamNacSlaveIpMask
